summary:
What it does is so simple. All jewelry prices in the game are doubled.
(Rings, necklaces, gems, circlets, dragon claws and amulets)
descriptionHtml:
=== [b][color=#ffd966][size=3]Description[/size][/color][/b] ===


What this mod does is so simple. All jewelry prices in the game are doubled. So, if you want to sell a gold necklace you will sell it for 240 golds instead of 120. You can call this expensive or profitable, difficult or cheating. You can find thievery more rewarding and worths to play or you can find earning money and buying things harder. It's your choise how to play with it. I hope you will enjoy

[b]
Changed items:[/b]

All silver, gold and jeweled rings.

All silver, gold and jeweled necklaces.

All enchanted rings and necklaces.

All types of gems (except soul gems, they are not doubled)

All types of amulets.

All types of enchantes and non-enchanted circlets.

All dragon claws.

All quest related rings, necklaces, gems, circlets, dragon claws and amulets. (Such as "Necromancer Amulet", "Ring of Hircine", "Righ Eye of Falmer" or "Diamond Claw")



=== [color=#ffd966][size=3][b]Requirements[/b][/size][/color] ===


Dragonborn and Dawnguard DLCs.



=== [color=#ffd966][size=3][b]Compatibility[/b][/size][/color] ===


It may not be compatible with the mods that alters with rings, necklaces, gems, circlets, dragon claws and amulets. Especially the quest related ones. To prevent incompatibility issues you should put this mod at high as possible in your load order. Maybe you will lose some of new prices but at least you will keep the contents or effects from other mods that change things in jewelry items.
author: Voixdeville
